Description: Houston-based Compaq Computer Corporation agreed to pay the United States $4.5 million to settle claims that Digital Equipment Corporation, which Compaq had purchased in 1998, inflated its labor costs on a Defense Department contract to install computer network equipment.

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Company: ZAO Hewlett-Packard A.O. and Hewlett-Packard Polska, Sp. Z o.o.  and Hewlett-Packard Mexico, S. de R.L. de C.V.
Description: ZAO Hewlett-Packard A.O., a subsidiary of what was then Hewlett-Packard Company, pleaded guilty to felony violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act involving bribes to Russian government officials. In addition an H-P Polish subsidiary signed a deferred prosecution agreement and a Mexican subsidiary signed a non-prosecution agreement relating to other FCPA charges. In total, the three H-P entities agreed to pay $76,760,224 in criminal penalties and forfeiture.
Prosecution Agreement: plea & deferred prosecution agreement & non-prosecution agreement

Description: Hewlett-Packard agreed to pay $14.5 million and adopt governance reforms to resolve allegations the firm used false pretenses - or pretexting - to unlawfully access phone records during its probe of boardroom leaks to the media.

$35,000 fine levied and order to pay $1,136 in premium taxes, interest, and penalty for selling 495 service contracts to Washington residents after its registration was suspended. RCW 48.110.030(1), RCW 48.110.050(1), RCW 48.05.030(1), RCW 48.15.020(1)
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
